text.p: American Depositary Shares in Russia's RAO Gazprom were quoted at $18.25/$18.75 by the close in London after being priced on Monday at $15.75 per ADS. "I would not be surprised to see the ADS go over $20.00 once New York is in there," said the head of trading at a European bank.
Some investors believe that the ADS will show gains for some time yet, before profit taking sets in.
"The ADS could be frothy for some time, but then we will see what happens," said a fund manager.
The ADS had traded as high as $19.50 in morning trade in London and closed at a 264 percent premium to the underlying Gazprom stock which ended in Moscow at 50.5 cents, off a high of 53 cents.
Others traders say that the ADS has now found its trading level after hitting $19.50 in the morning.
"There was a little bit of stock coming out after the high," said one trader.
However, one trader at a U.S. bank in New York said that he had been inundated with calls on the stock from investors.
